excellent post Jen, it's nice to have good reading material, wish I could
think that descript.
----- Original Message -----
From: Jen D. <jeniff@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, February 22, 2001 11:53 PM
Subject: Hello guys!


> (OOC: Hi everyone! I'm sorry to have dissapeared for a long time. My life
> fell apart pretty fast and i didn't have time for the internet. but things
> have quieted down now and I have some time on the internet. I had yan fill
> me in on things, so I think i know whats going on. I won't be taking any
> characters that I left behind when i dissapeared, but i'll be bringing in
> some new ones. i took some writing classes when i could, so my writing
> should be better, but its hard to go to school when youre in my situation,
> so please don't be mad if its bad. i still have very little time, so yan
can
> post for me if i dissapear suddenly. I'll try to inform him so that he
knows
> when to take over, but if you see him posting with my chars, its ok.
>
> The only people I still reconize are Yan, JP, and KSLawdogg (all meanies)!
> oh yeah, and yan gave me permission to copy his idea of the galators
(sp?),
> so no one get mad at me for it! :)
>
> My post:
>
> Cinder, Aqua, Mist, Rubble, and Mantle were in a ship heading for earth.
> They were originaly part of the same team that Prowl (yan gave me
permission
> :) came to earth with, but had been seperated while out on a mission. When
> they were coming back to Striker's ship, they saw it enter a transwarp
> portal, and followed. They overshot and ended up in the future, after
> Striker's crew had landed, but their hopes were high anyways.
>
> Cinder sighed, looking out the small viewport of the hall at the slowly
> oncoming little blue pretty planet. The Eletors, which was the name of the
> group that consisted of Cinder and her sibblings, were a new breed of
> Maximals. They were made after the maximals reached the same level of
> fighting technology that the predacons had used to make the galators.
After
> they were tested for bugs and any bugs that had been found were fixed,
they
> were assigned to Striker's team. They went on many missions together, but
> the latest one had taken them far from Striker's ship, and that was why
they
> were now following them and hoping that there were survivors. Cinder heard
> footsteps behind her, knowing that it was one of her sibblings checking on
> her. She knew they were worried, and she couldn't blame them, but she
> couldn't help but worry about the condition of her friends on earth.
>
> "Do you think he's still alive?" she asked the bot that approached behind
> her. Her voice was as worried as her thoughts, and she kinda felt sorry
for
> worrying her brothers and sisters.
>
> "Us Maximals are survivors, Cinder," a male voice replied to her question.
> She knew that he knew who she was talking about. "He'll be ok. We couldn't
> have overshot by more than a year, and they could easily survive that
long.
>
> Cinder looked back at her brother Aqua, her eyes a bit wet from worrying.
> She had a sleek, well shaped body with two red stripes going up her sides
> and an orange one down her middle and back. Her hair was crimson colored.
> The ship had scanned the planet and detected energon a little whiles away,
> giving the Eletors beast modes to suit earth. Cinder had a long, bushy fox
> tail swinging slowly back and forth from her rear. "I hope you're right,
> brother. I hope we're not too late."
>
> Aqua walked up and hugged his sister. He was colored different shades of
> blue. His beast mode, a blend of a dolphin and a shark, contributed to his
> compassionate attitude and his excellent fighting skills. "Don't worry,
> they're allright," he repeated. "Do you want something to eat? Everyone is
> at the mess hall. You can take your mind off of the situation for the
> matter."
>
> Cinder nodded, returning Aqua's hug greatfully. She walked with him
through
> the ship back toward the mess hall. They entered and walked to the main
> table, where the rest of the team was seated. Cinder looked around at her
> other brothers and sisters, managing a smile for them. She sat down on the
> chair that Aqua pulled out for her, and then watched him sit down near
her.
> Aqua was the closest to her of all her family, probably closest to
everyone
> else too. He always cared for people's feelings.
>
> "We're almost in range to make a complete scan of the planet for any
> transformers," Mantle, the bot in charge of the group, said. He was
> officially the bot in charge but the eletors were more like a family, with
> Mantle acting a bit as the father, Mist as the mother, and the rest of
them
> as kids. Mantle was created first of eletors, then Mist, Rubble, Aqua, and
> finally Cinder. Being the youngest, Cinder was usually pampered, and she
> hated it. She never got to do anything fun! But right now everyone was
> looking at her to see how she felt about this, as usual concerned with her
> state of mind. They all knew why she was worried about the state of the
bots
> on the planet, although she wished they didn't know. She nodded, looking
> down at her food and picking at it.
>
> "Don't worry, they'll be ok." Mist leaned over and patted Cinder on the
> shoulder, trying to confort her. Mist was almost as attractive as Cinder,
> although she was slightly older and wiser, and less entusiastic about
> things. Her body was a very light blue, lighter than Aqua's. Mist was
> compassionate to all her friends, not to the point that Aqua was, but
still
> very compassionate. She hugged Cinder and then went back to her food,
> glaring at Rubble for a second when Rubble burped loudly.
>
> "Sorry," Rubble mumbled, going back to his food. He was a big, strong bot,
> his coloring ranging from grey to brown. Even though he was male to the
> core, he cared very much for his family, and would give his life for any
of
> them. In a few minutes, Mantle stood up.
>
> "Ok, everyone, let's get the scan going," he said and walked out of the
> room. As he left he motioned for the rest to follow. Cinder and her family
> stood up, following him toward the control room.
>
>
>
> - Jen D :)
